definitions.definition: To play about roughly, energetically or boisterously.
examples: When the kids're allowed to romp in the bedroom, they break something.

definitions.definition: To press forcefully, to encourage vehemently, to oppress.
examples: If I romp down on the gas , it'll do sixty in six seconds.
Coach Smith had to romp on 'em to get 'em out of a losing streak .
England romped to an easy win over Australia.

definitions.definition: To move with little effort relatively quickly.
examples: We romped along with the wind astern.

definitions.definition: To engage in playful or illicit sex.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To play about roughly, energetically or boisterously.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , US ) (Often used with down ) To press forcefully, to encourage vehemently, to oppress.
( with adverb ) To move with little effort relatively quickly.
( slang , chiefly newspapers ) To engage in playful or illicit sex.
